oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: My Reading Booklet
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Citizenship booklet with information on topics such as South Carolina voter registration, political parties, and social security.

This booklet would have been distributed at citizenship schools in South Carolina to educate and inform Sea Islanders on civil rights, social security, and healthcare options, and civic engagement. In the 1950s, Highlander shifted its focus to Civil Rights and school integration. They held workshops to train organizers and held citizenship courses to help African Americans pass onerous literacy tests in order to vote. They eventually trained teachers to expand their network across the South.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Literacy tests (Election law); Leadership; Voter registration; Social security; Political parties; Civil rights; Students--Political activity
